MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Web.Mvc.MvcHtmlString AntiForgeryToken() cil managed

Docs.summary: Generates a hidden form field (anti-forgery token) that is validated when the form is submitted.
Docs.returns: The generated form field (anti-forgery token).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Web.Mvc.MvcHtmlString AntiForgeryToken(string salt) cil managed
Public Function AntiForgeryToken (salt As String) As MvcHtmlString

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This method is deprecated. Use the AntiForgeryToken() method instead. To specify custom data to be embedded within the token, use the static AntiForgeryConfig.AdditionalDataProvider property.", true)

Docs.param: The salt value, which can be any non-empty string.
Docs.summary: Generates a hidden form field (anti-forgery token) that is validated when the form is submitted. The field value is generated using the specified salt value.
Docs.returns: The generated form field (anti-forgery token).

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Web.Mvc.MvcHtmlString AntiForgeryToken (string salt, string domain, string path);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Web.Mvc.MvcHtmlString AntiForgeryToken(string salt, string domain, string path) cil managed
Public Function AntiForgeryToken (salt As String, domain As String, path As String) As MvcHtmlString
member this.AntiForgeryToken : string * string * string -> System.Web.Mvc.MvcHtmlString

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("This method is deprecated. Use the AntiForgeryToken() method instead. To specify a custom domain for the generated cookie, use the <httpCookies> configuration element. To specify custom data to be embedded within the token, use the static AntiForgeryConfig.AdditionalDataProvider property.", true)

Docs.param: The salt value, which can be any non-empty string.
The application domain.
The virtual path.
Docs.summary: Generates a hidden form field (anti-forgery token) that is validated when the form is submitted. The field value is generated using the specified salt value, domain, and path.
Docs.returns: The generated form field (anti-forgery token).

Docs.param: The context of the HTTP request.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string GenerateLink (System.Web.Routing.RequestContext requestContext, System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection routeCollection, string linkText, string routeName, string actionName, string controllerName, string protocol, string hostName, string fragment, System.Web.Routing.RouteValueDictionary routeValues, System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,object> htmlAttributes);

MemberSignature.Usage: System.Web.Mvc.HtmlHelper.GenerateLink (requestContext, routeCollection, linkText, routeName, actionName, controllerName, protocol, hostName, fragment, routeValues, htmlAttributes)

Docs.param: The context of the HTTP request.
The collection of URL routes.
The text caption to display for the link.
The name of the route that is used to return a virtual path.
The name of the action method.
The name of the controller.
The communication protocol, such as HTTP or HTTPS. If this parameter is null, the protocol defaults to HTTP.
The name of the host.
The fragment identifier.
An object that contains the parameters for a route.
An object that contains the HTML attributes for the element.
Docs.summary: Generates an HTML anchor element (a element) that links to the specified action method, and enables the user to specify the communication protocol, name of the host, and a URL fragment.
Docs.returns: An HTML element that links to the specified action method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<string, object> ObjectToDictionary(object value) cil managed
Public Shared Function ObjectToDictionary (value As Object) As IDictionary(Of String, Object)

Docs.param: The object to be converted.
Docs.summary: Creates a dictionary from an object, by adding each public instance property as a key with its associated value to the dictionary. It will expose public properties from derived types as well. This is typically used with objects of an anonymous type.
Docs.returns: The created dictionary of property names and property values.
